text:
Consider file A.jsp which includes file B.jsp:

A.jsp:
...
<%@ include file="B.jsp" %>
...

If A.jsp is modified, Jasper detects the modification and generates a new class.
 If B.jsp is modified, Jasper does not detect the modification and no new class
is generated.

The bug is that stale content will be served after updating B.jsp.
creator: pogo_tomcat@yahoo.com

text:
The way that this was addressed in GNUJSP was to put the out-of-date check into
a method that was part of the compiled JSP class, since the compiler has access
to all the included files.  Then rather than check the top level file directly
inside JSPServlet, one would call into the compiled servlet to do the check.
creator: pogo_tomcat@yahoo.com
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
The bug is partially fixed in 3.3 ( JspInterceptor uses the same reloading 
mechansim as for servlets, and that tracks all dependencies ). A complete fix 
will be available in jasper34 or later.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: This is resolved in Jasper34, very unlikely to be done in tc3.3.
